title: Ex-BAEC chair Manjurul dies
body: Md Manjurul Haque, a former chairman of the Bangladesh Atomic Energy Commission, passed away at a hospital in the capital on Tuesday. He was about 67. He is survived by his wife, one son and a daughter. Manjurul Haque was born on September 1, 1958, in Nilphamari district. He joined the Bangladesh Atomic Energy Commission in 1981 and made significant contributions to the development and research of nuclear science and technology during his long career. He served as the chairman of the commission with great skill, honesty and sincerity. The funeral prayer of the deceased was held on the day after Maghrib at the premises of the head office of the Bangladesh Atomic Energy Commission. All levels of staff of the commission prayed for the eternal peace of the departed soul and expressed their deepest condolences to the bereaved family.
